column4: i have a question, it's prolly pretty common, but it's something i want to find out

i use Debian and i installed Ubuntu on my dad's computer so he could try out Linux (and Ubuntu is, IMO a bit mor noobish version of Debian) in debian, i can su to be root for a terminal session, in Ubuntu, i can't, why can't i su in Ubuntu?
You can open a root terminal
Again, you can open a root terminal
